Posts.Content: May 26, 2018 07:22AM Pammac47 wrote: Sorry you find yourself here. I too had a long wait for results, found out later my reason was the same as yours. In hindsight I wish I would’ve took a big breath and gone for some tlc. Gone to the beach or just took a walk somewhere peaceful and nice. Not trying to be glib. The part your going through is the most stressful. Once you have answers you know one way or another. Things seem to go very slow at the beginning if that is what turns out to be. I wish you all the best and our thoughts are with you
Posts.Title: BiRads5/Second opinion ByTheSea2 Rrobin0200

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2016 10:14AM - edited Feb 7, 2016 10:16AM by Pammac47 I am awaiting biopsy results to even find out if I have BC, it was 2/4/2016. However I have one thing that's more than annoying. I do have pain in breast and lymphedema including extreme tingling in fingers. There's is swelling under arm, as well. I showed radiologist and they took US pictures of axillary area when did bx. I have not heard of this prior to surgery. it doesn't effect doing stuff, but it's always there. Anyone? Is there anything natural I can do to help also?
Posts.Title: VISIBLE SIGNS OF LYMPHEDEMA - A PICTORIAL LindaLou53 glennie19

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2016 05:10AM - edited Dec 12, 2016 05:11AM by Pammac47 I too felt first and skin was extremely dark between breast after first, but has since returned to pink. Second and third felt nothing. I've got no idea as to why although that area is the most sensitive after surgery could be, or in my case at least. Chances are there are more as well folks like us. Hang in there as you are never all alone. Hugs Pam
Posts.Title: Radiation--pain?? Tbirdy321 Celand

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2016 04:17AM - edited Feb 15, 2016 03:39AM by Pammac47 Thanks took a couple days. Frankly the pain has made some things I used to enjoy hard to say the least. I have been told pain is cause it's growing. Anyway I am now set to not only see the surgeon, but an onocologist and a radiologist on Tuesday the 16th. I'm scared, yes. The size, how quick it got there, and the new things going on with my body are all weighing on my mind. However there is one true comfort, I am not alone. Someone has been in my shoes. So many had to go before me for new treatments to be found. So my life is changing and I have fear, I cry because I am not done living, but know I have to fight to continue. Maybe someday we can find a cure, so my daughter never has to go through this. Or any of our daughters, sons or grandkids for that matter. By the way all I've been told is that Adenocarcinoma grade 3. We know 5cm+, but understand that could change
Posts.Title: Got the news Pammac47 Pammac47

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2016 07:05PM Pammac47 wrote: Wow!! Sounds promising but my mass is over 5cm I've been told the pain is from it growing. Honestly I really do feel relieved its er+ I had pictured worse. Anyway I'm determined to enjoy a few days prior to seeing the breast surgeon and signing up for battle. My prayers are for those not diagnosed that their news will be better. Signing off for a few days to breathe and live hopefully sleep better. Thanks to all. Oh and I such a bad person I must confess in my anger yesterday. I made the awful assumption the hospital did not send pathology report as pcp told me they did not have. Upon further investigating they did and I got my answer. It's insulting to those folks who were so terribly kind to me when I was at hospital, that I would let this reduce me to that. Shame on me, while they wouldn't release info to me. They did send to my pcp. I owe them a debt of apology and thanks-central florida regional and sincerely hope to never repeat that ugliness again. I need to heal my soul so I'm taking a few days to just get my head right. Love you al

Posts.Title: How many weeks of radiation? ChattyKat Pammac47

Posts.Content: Pammac47 wrote: Thursday at 11am, I'm going in for core needle biopsy and another mammogram. I'm trying hard to be positive, but I'm failing everyday. I have to fake it, but my insides are a real mess. The only facts to date are my mass is growing very fast and is estimated at 6cm by ultrasound as of 1/21/2016. Since then my lymph under arm has swollen from breast up with a grape size poop thing under left arm. I have been told it's cancer, by radiologist who ran ultrasound, but know he shouldn't have told me that. My mass hurts it actually feels alive for lack of a better definition to describe. I've been wearing a bra since ultrasound so I can sleep. I'm afraid and looking for any hope to hang on to Thank Chemotherapy 3/22/2016 AC + T (Taxol) Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Radiation Therapy Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Log in to post a reply

Thanks to all wishing me wel

Posts.Title: Starting Rads in January 2017 ElizabethAM Caligirl55

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2017 08:24PM Pammac47 wrote: cali girl I take naps go to bed early and still oversleep. My pink has gone to brown hue. Got nails done got zilch for feeling on left foot it might have been someone else foot- like a piece of dead meat, have minimal on right but better. Going in for MRI Saturday!! I'm over all the pain but wish it was over me Rita- As for your RO I sometimes think they are off their game as well. I told mine had pain under boob(right under) she said that's not from radiation. Well that's funny cause it's also brown hue, hurts and everything I've read says that's why. So I too leave shaking my head. Your no alone sometimes they could empathize more. I am tired by noon and drag til my new 830-9 bedtime, but alas I must wash my wig tonight
Posts.Title: Starting Rads in January 2017 ElizabethAM Caligirl55

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2017 09:26PM Pammac47 wrote: Hi all I'm in 19/33 and my skin is holding up with only the middle patch needing silverdene. The rest has some patches that are darker. I also have itchiness above radiated zone?? That's my radiation skin. Still have nerve pain from surgery that's what ro calls it. Neuropathy from chemo and a lovely sciatic nerve issue trying to act up. That one radiates to hip and spasms down leg. I'm currently a mess but just keep going. Frankly it makes me old, tired and grumpy.

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2016 08:45PM Pammac47 wrote: Deepshadows, As I may be one of those "stories" I owe you an apology that I may have caused you to worry about ultrasound accuracy. I had that same day reviewed my CDs in which May 2014 ultrasound showed nothing very significant. The fact is radiologist advised me to get a mammo I did not and frankly there's no guarantee anything would have been found then. I did not go for a lump. I had mild swelling in lymph node. I had also just gotten over bout of being sick. I was angry because in December I noticed at Christmas a large lump which is noticeable on diagnostic mammo now. I do not know what will become but it does need a biopsy. Sometimes that's the way things go and I wanted to blame radiologist for missing something. I'm in healthcare and my rational side just wasn't here. Please discuss any concerns with your doctor. Don't myself think you should worry as I believe all is well with you
Posts.Title: Terrified and in pain Deepshadows Kicks

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2016 09:26AM Pammac47 wrote: I am also scared, but wanted to post an advisory. Don't count on ultrasound. I had an ultrasound done 8mos ago because I felt pain and inflammation in left lymph of armpit this came back normal. Today I am waiting to have core biopsy which won't be done till February. Insurance. I found a lump around Christmas, had diagnostic mammo and yes that's recommendation. It can be felt by all and now my lymph node has also started to swell. Anyway, if they recommend another test do it don't go on your way thinking all good. That's all I've got. Good Luc
Posts.Title: Terrified and in pain Deepshadows Kicks

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2016 10:32PM Pammac47 wrote: I am not diagnosed still waiting on results, but I keep thinking of drowning my boob in a huge vat of booze, for some reason that cheers me up. Get it drunk, talk to it, make it see reason!! Oh Lord, I never was right...but neither is this. Maybe this helps, or maybe I'm venting who knows. Truth is if your diagnosed your gearing up for a fight and you give it your all. This thread and discussions have been a source of strength just to see the hope of others makes me stronger and I can't thank you all enough, Pam
Posts.Title: I am so scared please lift my spirits rosierosie Danni1016

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2016 11:11AM Pammac47 wrote: Melissa, I was not suggesting to not rely on ultrasound and understand the younger dense breast issue with mammograms. I also agree that she most likely has nothing to worry about maybe I should have thought more about post, sorry. I am not a young woman myself am 51. That was my unique situation. I was only saying that we know our own bodies and history in family. I was ordered for ultrasound in May 2015. He recommended I have follow up mammogram. I felt the ultrasound was good enough. Found lump in Dec 2015. Diagnostic mammo shows a very large lump and my lymph node is swollen. I was trying to say be vigilant and do any follow up testing they recommend. I'm unsure if it would have made any difference to me, but wouldn't be going what if. Anyway I don't even have my own answers yet. Next is my ultrasound guided core biopsy.

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2016 11:27AM Pammac47 wrote: Deepshadows, I too agree that worry is a wasted emotion and it seperates you from living life. Don't let it consume you, live life, deal with facts not unknowns. Good Luck and I hope all goes well. It sounds like life is good for you enjoy that!!
Posts.Title: Terrified and in pain Deepshadows Kicks

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2016 02:40PM Pammac47 wrote: Deepshadows, I am not in mental health, but have worked with some cancer patients and their loved ones. There is a heightened anxiety level around the unknown for some this persists beyond getting a positive outcome. If you have recently experienced the loss of someone close from cancer as well as going through your own diagnosis process. Some have what we used to term "survivors guilt". I don't know but a doctor might be best suited to allay your fears and perhaps determine if you need something for anxiety, please do take care of yourself, and seek help if necessary
